headline: Timeline: A history of rent stabilization in Southern California
text:
In response to low rental vacancy rates in the late-1970s, Los Angeles approved a series of rental stabilization measures aimed at capping the rents that a landlord could charge. Several cities -- Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and others -- followed suit.

Since, state legislation has watered down these measures, effectively keeping any new rental housing from falling under rent stabilization ordinances.

This timeline looks back at measures to control rent and those that remove some of those limitations.
